title: Fan denies using slur during incident with Metcalf
content: The fan involved in the altercation with the Steelers' DK Metcalf on Sunday denied using a slur during the incident, according to a statement issued by a Michigan law firm.

title: Notre Dame-BYU series puts USC rivalry on pause
content: Notre Dame and BYU have agreed to a home-and-home series beginning next season, marking a halt in the Fighting Irish's longtime annual series with rival USC.

title: Michigan closing in on No. 1 Arizona in men's poll
content: No. 2 Michigan is closing the gap on Arizona, which remains No. 1 on the AP Top 25 men's college basketball poll for the third straight week.

title: Kansas approves proposal for new Chiefs stadium
content: Kansas lawmakers approved a proposal Monday to help pay for a new stadium for the Chiefs, which is expected to lure one of the NFL's iconic franchises across the state line from Missouri and replace popular but aging Arrowhead Stadium.

title: Sources: UNC works toward hiring Petrino as OC
content: North Carolina is working toward hiring Bobby Petrino as the new offensive coordinator for Bill Belichick's staff, sources told ESPN

title: Interim coach: I can fix 'malfunctioning' Michigan
content: Michigan interim coach Biff Poggi described the program as a "malfunctioning organization" after a series of high-profile scandals, one he hopes to "fix" if he becomes the team's permanent coach.

title: Day to call plays for OSU in CFP game vs. Miami
content: Ohio State coach Ryan Day said he will take over calling offensive plays in the Buckeyes' College Football Playoff opener on New Year's Eve against Miami.

title: Versatile Polanco willing to move to 1B for Mets
content: Jorge Polanco's experience playing first base is all of one pitch, but it figures to be his primary position after signing a $40 million, two-year deal with the Mets.

content: It's Oregon-Texas Tech, Ole Miss-Georgia, Miami-Ohio State and Alabama- Indiana: Here's what to expect.

content: Who has reason for jeer this holiday season? We break down which teams' fans have the most reasons to be mad.

content: Which two-way and minimum-level players are providing the biggest boosts to their teams? Bobby Marks unveils his roster.

content: Yes, Philip Rivers unretired and is now the starting QB for a team in the playoff race. No, this is not a movie.

content: Saleh has the 49ers' defense staying afloat amid injuries and turnover. Could he leave this offseason?

content: Arizona retains the top spot. Duke falls three positions. USC and Iowa replace St. John's and Auburn.

content: The seventh in-season women's AP Top 25 poll is out. Here's what's next for every team in the standings.

title: Logan Lednicky caps dream with volleyball title at Texas A&M
content: The fourth-generation Aggie helped Texas A&M win its first volleyball title in a most improbable fashion.

content: As the holiday break approaches, the Maple Leafs aren't exactly excelling. Plus, key games in the week ahead.

title: Midseason LaLiga verdicts: Bar√ßa lead the way, but is there a title race?
content: Some things changed in the first half of LaLiga's 2025-26 season (Espanyol a contender?) and some things, like Lamine Yamal's brilliance, have stayed the same. Here's what Graham Hunter made of things before we hit 2026.

title: Buzz: Omarion Hampton trending up and more notes from Week 16
content: Omarion Hampton is getting more work, Barkley is getting it done on the ground, and more takeaways from Week 16.

content: All of the free agent options worth adding as we dive into Week 17 and the fantasy football championships.

title: What did Cowboys get right in Schottenheimer's first season?
content: It was another disappointing season in Dallas, but that doesn't mean there weren't some bright spots.

title: 2025 MMA awards: Joshua Van's breakout year earns him multiple honors
content: With MMA on a end-of-year break, an ESPN panel voted on their best of 2025, including best event, fighters, submission and knockout.

content: Week 17 features critical matchups with the NFL playoffs approaching. Here are the odds, spreads and totals for every game.

title: Betting lines for each College Football Playoff quarterfinal matchup, bowl games
content: Lines for Miami-Ohio State, Oregon-Texas Tech, Alabama-Indiana, Ole Miss-Georgia and remaining bowl games.

title: Most fashionable arrivals of NFL Week 16, featuring Stefon Diggs
content: Before the NFL's Saturday slate kicked off, players made sure to put their most fashionable foot forward.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Real Madrid, Man City, Liverpool eye Bayern star Olise
content: Bayern Munich's Michael Olise is wanted by a host of other top European clubs. Transfer Talk has the latest news and rumors.

title: Pickups: Raynaud, Landale among several quality center options
content: Every week in fantasy basketball, there are available players who can help fill holes in your roster. Here are the ones to add for the week ahead.

title: Uttarakhand mute spectator to grabbing of forest land: Supreme Court
content: The Supreme Court expressed shock over private individuals grabbing thousands of acres of forest land in Uttarakhand, with the state government acting as a silent spectator. The court has expanded the case to examine the alleged illegal leasing and allotment of 2,866 acres of forest land, ordering a probe and directing all parties to maintain status quo.

title: Indian cricket: BCCI takes a big step; to give pay hike to women domestic players
content: The Board of Control for Cricket in India (BCCI) has approved a major pay hike for India‚Äôs women domestic cricketers, more than doubling match fees across senior and junior levels. Senior players will now earn up to Rs 50,000 per day. The decision follows India‚Äôs Women‚Äôs ODI World Cup win.

title: Assault over 'tu': Doctor suspended for hitting patient in Shimla hospital
content: A doctor at Shimla's IGMC was suspended after a video showed him brutally assaulting a patient who objected to being addressed disrespectfully. The patient alleged the doctor began punching him after he asked for politeness. An inquiry is underway, with authorities promising exemplary action against the involved medical staff.

title: Meta‚Äôs most-famous employee to students: Do not study computer; focus on core subjects
content: AI pioneer Yann LeCun advises computer science students to prioritize foundational subjects like math and physics over trendy technology courses. He argues that a strong grasp of core principles, often found in engineering disciplines, is crucial for long-term adaptability in the rapidly evolving tech landscape.

title: 'No new mining': Amid uproar, Centre clarifies Aravalli order; defends new definition
content: Speaking on the Supreme Court's acceptance of the "new definition" of Aravalli, the minister said: "The ruling recognises and endorses the Government of India‚Äôs sustained efforts to protect the Aravalli range through scientific assessment, strict safeguards and initiatives such as the Aravalli Green Wall Project." Yadav explained that the Aravali range comprises all landforms located within 500 metres of two adjoining hills with a height of 100 metres or more.

title: 'Dead' man returns, Chhattisgarh murder case on 4 collapses
content: A murder investigation in Chhattisgarh took a strange turn when the "victim," believed dead and buried for 61 days, reappeared after working in Jharkhand. His family had reported him missing, and four acquaintances were arrested for his alleged murder based on a charred body and confessions.

title: Retreat from LLMs: Salesforce pivots to deterministic AI; shift may impact enterprises
content: Salesforce is scaling back its reliance on large language models due to reliability issues, as acknowledged by executives. The company is shifting towards more predictable 'deterministic' automation in its Agentforce product, aiming to eliminate AI's inherent randomness.

title: Rs 8 crore lost in online fraud, ex-IPS officer shoots self; critical
content: A former Punjab police IG, Amar Singh Chahal, is critically injured after allegedly shooting himself following an Rs 8.1 crore online investment fraud.  A detailed note found at his Patiala home outlines how he was duped by a group named "F-777 DBS Wealth Equity Research Group." Police are investigating the sophisticated scam and tracing digital evidence.

title: India-NZ FTA: Faced with Trump tariffs, why new trade deals are important - explained
content: India and New Zealand have finalized a Free Trade Agreement, promising duty-free entry for Indian goods and $20 billion in New Zealand investments over 15 years. The pact aims to double bilateral trade within five years, though New Zealand's foreign minister expressed opposition, deeming it 'neither free nor fair'.

title: After cutting Amazon stake: Jeff Bezos‚Äô ex-wife donates billions in 2025; 186 groups benefit
content: MacKenzie Scott has donated over $7.1 billion in 2025 to 186 organizations globally, including universities and environmental nonprofits, marking her largest annual giveaway. This significant philanthropic effort, detailed on her website Yield Giving, continues her focus on diversity, equity, and inclusion initiatives, with substantial contributions to institutions like Howard University and the UNCF.

title: 'Picture abhi baaki hain': U19 Asia Cup lost; George's show yet to unfold
content: Aaron George‚Äôs U-19 Asia Cup showed maturity, control and leadership, but only a glimpse of his true attacking ability, say those close to him. Backed by coach Biju Nair and shaped by his disciplined upbringing, the Hyderabad captain has grown steadily through tough challenges. With the U-19 World Cup ahead, many believe his full potential is yet to unfold.

title: Watch: Virat Kohli spotted at Mumbai airport; returns to Vijay Hazare Trophy
content: Former India captain Virat Kohli is set to play for Delhi in the upcoming Vijay Hazare Trophy, marking a return to domestic cricket.  His presence, alongside experienced players like Ishant Sharma and Navdeep Saini, adds significant buzz to Delhi's campaign. Kohli enters the tournament in strong ODI form, aiming to reconnect with the domestic grind and lead by example.

title: K'taka honour killing: Pregnant woman beaten to death over inter-caste marriage; 3 held
content: A 20-year-old woman, Manya Patil, has died from injuries sustained in an alleged honour killing in Dharwad. Three individuals, identified as Prakash, Veeran, and Arun, have been arrested for the assault, which reportedly involved a pipe. Manya's mother-in-law, father-in-law, and sister also suffered injuries during the incident. Investigations are continuing.

title: Who is Aaron Rodgers‚Äô wife Brittani? Inside the Steelers QB‚Äôs marriage mystery
content: Steelers quarterback Aaron Rodgers has found unexpected peace in his marriage to Brittani.  Unlike his previous public relationships, Brittani values privacy.  Rodgers credits his wife with providing unconditional love and stability.  This new chapter sees a calmer, more focused Rodgers as he navigates his final NFL years.  His teammates and coaches notice the positive change.

title: Vince & Linda McMahon net worth 2025: WWE earnings & business success
content: Wrestling titans Vince and Linda McMahon boast a $3.2 billion net worth in 2025, largely from their WWE empire and TKO Group Holdings shares. Vince's legacy in transforming wrestling is undeniable, while Linda also carved a significant business and political path. Despite recent legal challenges for Vince, their financial success endures.

title: Christen Goff reveals how motherhood transformed the Goffs‚Äô family homes
content: Christen Goff is navigating motherhood by creating two distinct yet personal homes in Los Angeles and Michigan for her and daughter Romy.  She thoughtfully designs each space to reflect its location and their evolving family identity.  Despite the challenges of a newborn and dual residences, Christen finds joy and belonging in this new chapter.

title: 8 runs short of history: When Faf and ABD nearly pulled off an impossible
content: South Africa narrowly missed a historic chase of 458 against India at the Wanderers, falling just eight runs short in a thrilling draw. Faf du Plessis and AB de Villiers forged a monumental partnership, bringing the Proteas to the brink.  The match also highlighted the emergence of India's young batting stars, Kohli, Pujara, and Rahane.

title: After Bachchans, Salman Khan, R Madhavan moves court over personality rights
content: Actor R Madhavan has secured legal protection for his personality rights from the Delhi High Court, preventing unauthorized use of his name and image. This follows similar court orders for other public figures like Amitabh Bachchan and Aishwarya Rai Bachchan, who are increasingly seeking legal recourse to protect their likeness and prevent misuse, especially with the rise of AI.

title: Uorfi Javed on late night ordeal: 'When someone comes at 3am and refuses to leave ...'
content: After calling it the scariest experience of her life, Uorfi Javed opens up about an unsettling 3.30 am incident involving unknown men at her doorstep. She details the sequence of events, police action and her concerns over residential safety.

title: Who is Nick Suzuki‚Äôs wife? Inside his life with Caitlin Fitzgerald
content: Montreal Canadiens captain Nick Suzuki has been gradually rising to be one of the most respected young leaders in the NHL. Together with his ascent on the ice, his long-lasting relationship with Caitlin Fitzgerald has also attracted attention. Since they had connected in Ontario at an early age to the time of their private marriage. This is the closest explanation of Suzuki's personal life and relationship path.

title: Resident Evil Zero Remake: Release date, what to expect & more details to know
content: Resident Evil Zero Remake is reportedly slated for an early 2028 release, following Resident Evil Requiem in 2026 and Code: Veronica Remake in 2027. This reimagining will feature a modernized Partner Zapping system, a third-person perspective, and improved inventory management, all set within photorealistic environments. The game will be developed for current-gen consoles and PC.

title: 'The real luxury': Chahal's post goes viral; wins hearts
content: Yuzvendra Chahal went viral after sharing an emotional post about buying a new BMW Z4 M40i with his parents, as he called their presence ‚Äúthe real luxury.‚Äù Retained by Punjab Kings for IPL 2026, Chahal has been out of India‚Äôs plans since 2023. He recently missed the SMAT final due to dengue and chikungunya, but the spinner promised a strong return.

title: Men, are you ignoring breast cancer symptoms? Doctors share 4 tips to prevent it
content: Men, breast cancer is a reality, not just a woman's disease. Rare but serious, it often goes undiagnosed due to lack of awareness, leading to advanced stages. Genetic factors like BRCA mutations, age and lifestyle are key risks. Early detection through self-exams and prompt medical consultation significantly improves outcomes. Understanding symptoms and seeking care is vital for all.

title: Christmas 2025: Top 50 wishes, messages & quotes to share
content: As Christmas approaches, the festive spirit is palpable with decorations and a shopping frenzy. The article offers a curated collection of around 70 messages for friends, family, and colleagues, categorized into short, moving, spiritual, cheerful, and reflective wishes. These greetings aim to spread joy, love, and gratitude during the holiday season, encouraging connection and cherished moments.

title: Star Wars: Is Russia targeting Musk‚Äôs Starlink? Nato makes explosive claim
content: Nato intelligence suggests Russia is developing a novel anti-satellite weapon designed to release thousands of tiny metal pellets, potentially disabling multiple satellites, including Ukraine's vital Starlink constellation. This "zone-effect" weapon could create widespread, uncontrollable space debris, posing a significant threat to all orbital assets. Experts debate its practicality and potential repercussions.

title: 'People say MS Dhoni hurt my career': Ex-India cricketer's honest take goes viral - watch
content: Spinner Amit Mishra reflects positively on his relationship with former captain MS Dhoni, refuting claims that Dhoni hindered his career. Mishra credits Dhoni for his consistent comebacks and support, recalling a specific instance where Dhoni's advice led to a game-changing five-wicket haul. He emphasizes Dhoni's understanding of the game and his role in maximizing opportunities.

title: 'People will forget': Ex-India captain‚Äôs blunt warning to Sanju Samson
content: Sanju Samson's T20 World Cup selection is lauded by former selector Srikkanth, who urges him to convert starts into big scores. Samson seized his opportunity after a period out, while Shubman Gill's struggles and injury led to his omission. Srikkanth also highlighted India's formidable batting, calling it "intimidating and devastating."

title: 'I challenge Mamata': Suspended TMC MLA floats new party; Bengal CM hits back
content: Humayun Kabir, a West Bengal MLA, has launched his new political party, the Janata Unnayan Party. This move follows his suspension from the Trinamool Congress. Kabir plans to contest the 2026 West Bengal assembly elections. He aims to challenge Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee and has declared his intention to contest from two seats in Murshidabad

title: Ashes: Should McCullum and Stokes be sacked? Strauss opens up
content: Andrew Strauss says sacking Ben Stokes or Brendon McCullum will not solve England‚Äôs repeated Ashes failures in Australia. The former captain, England‚Äôs last Ashes winner Down Under, believes deeper structural changes are needed. With England 3-0 down again, Strauss warned against knee-jerk reactions and urged reforms to fix a long-standing system problem.

title: Vivek Oberoi clarifies SRK stardom comment after backlash
content: Vivek Oberoi clarified his recent controversial comment about Shah Rukh Khan's future relevance, stating his words were taken out of context. He emphasized that while superstardom is transient, good deeds and lasting legacies endure, drawing parallels with historical figures and contemporary stars. Oberoi reiterated his deep admiration and respect for SRK, highlighting their decades-long positive relationship.

title: Aaron Rodgers‚Äô heartfelt words about his wife deepen private life mystery
content: Aaron Rodgers has confirmed he is married but continues to keep his wife, Brittani, completely out of the public eye. His heartfelt comments describing her as ‚Äúincredible‚Äù have fueled curiosity, especially with no photos or appearances to confirm her identity. Rodgers‚Äô rare openness highlights a deeply private love story unfolding away from the spotlight.

title: B'desh to scale back diplomatic presence in India? What its FM said
content: The ministry of external affairs (MEA) on Saturday had said that about 20-25 youths gathered in front of the Bangladesh High Commission in New Delhi on Saturday and raised slogans, protesting the "horrendous killing" of Dipu Chandra Das, 25, who was lynched to death by a mob in Mymensingh on Thursday.

title: Maharashtra local body polls: Mahayuti sweeps, Congress hits roadblocks in Vidarbha
content: BJP emerged as the single largest party in Maharashtra's local body polls, securing 117 president posts and doubling its councillors since 2017. Despite challenges, the Mahayuti alliance, including Shiv Sena and NCP factions, celebrated a significant win, seen as a precursor to upcoming municipal corporation elections.

title: CBSE announces orientation programme on entrance exams for faculties in UP
content: CBSE has rescheduled its Orientation Programme on Entrance Exams and Career Pathways for Principals and Counsellors in Shahjahanpur, Uttar Pradesh. Originally postponed due to rising river levels, the offline event will now take place on December 30, 2025, at Seth M. R. Jaipuria School. The initiative aims to bolster career guidance and align school practices with NEP 2020.

title: U19 Asia Cup: Pak PM Sharif announces reward for winners; each player to get PKR 10 million
content: Pakistan Prime Minister Shahbaz Sharif announced a 10 million Pakistani rupees cash award for each U19 player after Pakistan thrashed India by 191 runs to win the U19 Asia Cup. Sameer Minhas starred with a brilliant 172, while Pakistan‚Äôs pacers dominated. Coaches and players praised teamwork, preparation, and collective effort behind the title win.

title: 'England have had a cockiness': Vaughan rips into Stokes & team; Ashes hammering the trigger
content: England‚Äôs Ashes 2025‚Äì26 campaign ended in disaster as Australia sealed a 3-0 lead within 11 days. Michael Vaughan criticised Ben Stokes‚Äô side for their failed approach, calling the tour ‚Äúhumbling.‚Äù Despite strong efforts from Stokes and Archer, England fell short chasing 435, with Australia dominating throughout and retaining the Ashes comfortably.

title: Life under the river: How the east‚Äìwest metro is redrawing Kolkata‚Äôs daily map
content: Kolkata's new East-West Metro, the Green Line, has revolutionized city travel with its groundbreaking underwater tunnel beneath the Hooghly River. This engineering marvel drastically cuts commute times between Salt Lake and Howrah, offering comfort and reliability. The line is already transforming daily life, easing congestion and connecting twin cities like never before.

title: On this day: Rohit Sharma stamped his authority with 35-ball T20I hundred; set new record
content: Eight years ago today, Rohit Sharma etched his name in T20I history by smashing a joint-fastest century off just 35 balls against Sri Lanka in Indore. This explosive innings, featuring 12 boundaries and 10 sixes, was a highlight of his stellar career before retiring after India's 2024 T20 World Cup triumph.

title: BrahMos and beyond: How UP is becoming India‚Äôs defence capital
content: India's supersonic prowess is taking flight from Lucknow with the inauguration of a state-of-the-art BrahMos Aerospace Integration and Testing Facility. This 200-acre complex is set to become the epicentre for producing the formidable BrahMos cruise missile, catering to surging domestic and international demand, including significant export orders.

title: US Says Venezuela's Maduro Needs To Be "Gone" From Power
content: US Homeland Security Secretary Kristi Noem said Monday that Venezuela's Nicolas Maduro needs to be "gone" from power, in one of the clearest indications yet that Washington is seeking a change of leadership in Caracas.

title: 1 Suspect Arrested In South Africa Mass Shooting That Killed 12
content: A 32-year-old suspect has been arrested in connection with a mass shooting which claimed the lives of 12 people including three children at an unlicensed pub earlier this month, South African police said on Monday.

title: "Happy To See This Progress": Shashi Tharoor On Bihar Infrastructure
content: The Nitish Kumar government's work on the infrastructure got a big thumbs up from Congress MP Shashi Tharoor on Monday. The BJP, Congress' national rival, is in alliance with Nitish Kumar's party, the JDU, in Bihar.

title: Trans Scientist Sues Trump Administration Over '2 Sexes' Order
content: A transgender employee of the National Security Agency is suing the Trump administration and seeking to block enforcement of a presidential executive order and other policies the employee says violate federal civil rights law.

title: 'Opposition's Role Is To Seek Answers': INLD's "Walkout" Swipe At Congress
content: Even while sharing the opposition benches with the Congress in the Haryana Legislative Assembly, the INLD did not miss an opportunity to take a sharp dig at the grand old party for repeatedly resorting to walkouts instead of sustained debate.

title: Israeli Soldiers Shoot 16-Year-Old For 'Throwing Brick At Them'
content: The Israeli military said it was reviewing an incident in the occupied West Bank in which soldiers shot dead a 16-year-old Palestinian who they said had thrown a brick at them, after CCTV footage appeared to show he was not doing so when shot.

title: Venezuela Says Russia Expressed 'Full Support' Against US 'Hostilities'
content: Venezuela's foreign minister said Monday Russia had expressed its "full support" as the South American country confronts a blockade of sanctioned oil tankers by US forces deployed in the Caribbean.

title: How A Remote Airstrip In Libya Reshaped Sudan's Civil War
content: A remote airstrip in southeastern Libya has reshaped Sudan's civil war by providing a lifeline to the Rapid Support Forces paramilitary group, according to more than a dozen military, intelligence and diplomatic officials.

title: Ambuja Cements Board Approves Amalgamation Of Cement Maker ACC, Orient Cement
content: The board of Adani group firm Ambuja Cements on Monday approved the amalgamation of subsidiaries ACC Ltd and Orient Cement with the company to create a pan-India cement powerhouse.

title: Russian General Killed In Moscow: 10 Assassinations Russia Blames On Ukraine
content: Russia has accused Ukraine of carrying out a number of high-profile attacks against prominent Russians since Moscow invaded its neighbour nearly four years ago.

title: "Want To Finish Exams And Go Home": Indian Medical Student In Bangladesh
content: For Ubair, a high-achieving student who held All India Rank 2 in the NEET exam, the dream of a medical degree is currently being tested by political instability in Bangladesh.

title: Centre Draws Line On IndiGo's Turkish Wet-Lease Plan, Extension Ends In 2026
content: The Ministry of Civil Aviation has said that IndiGo's permission to operate aircraft wet-leased from Turkey will end next year, making it clear that the extension granted till March 2026 will be the final one, with no further relaxations.

title: Meitei And Kuki Doctors Work Together, Quietly, To Save Lives In Manipur
content: Doctors from both the Meitei and Kuki communities in the injured border state Manipur have been quietly working together using technology to coordinate remotely with excellent precision to save lives.

title: How Trump's Immigration Focus Is Harming Efforts To Curb Gun Violence In US
content: The federal government has retreated from gun enforcement in Baltimore and elsewhere this year as more of its investigators turn their attention to  Trump's new priority for law enforcement: hunting immigrants in the US illegally to deport.

title: Russia "Ready" To Legally Confirm No Intent To Attack NATO
content: Russia is ready to confirm in a legal agreement that it has no intention of attacking either the European Union or the U.S.-led NATO military alliance, Russian Deputy Foreign Minister Sergei Ryabkov said

title: 2.12 Lakh New PUCs Issued In 4 Days As Delhi Cracks Down Under GRAP-IV
content: More than 2.12 lakh new PUC certificates were issued following the strict implementation of GRAP-IV measures over the past four days, Delhi Environment Minister Manjinder Singh Sirsa said on Monday.

title: Wife Claimed Husband Died In Washroom. Injuries Reveal Chilling Murder Plot
content: A 36-year-old woman and her paramour were among three persons arrested here for allegedly killing the woman's husband, who worked as a logistics manager at a private university, police said on Monday.

title: Bangladesh Temporarily Suspends Consular, Visa Services At High Commission In Delhi
content: The Bangladesh High Commission in New Delhi said on Monday that all consular and visa services have been temporarily suspended until further notice.

title: Singer Harassed While Performing 'Jago Maa'. What Is The Song All About?
content: Bengali singer Lagnajita Chakraborty was allegedly harassed for performing the song "Jago Maa" during a concert on Saturday, sparking widespread criticism.

title: 'Tis the szn': Chargers troll Cowboys multiple times after victory
content: the Los Angeles Chargers beat the Dallas Cowboys 34-17 on the road . it's their fourth straight win in a row . the team edited a clip from the 2004 film "The Polar Express" the conductor punches an "L" on a ticket for the cowboys.

title: After years away, Sunderland's Premier League return has revived the club and its city
content: sunderland beat Newcastle 1-0 in the first premier league game in nearly a decade . it was the longest postmatch celebration of the season . the team gathered for an impromptu photo, infuriating supporters and delighting their own .

title: Wetzel: Is this the last straw for NCAA enforcement?
content: Jeremy Pruitt coached the Vols from 2018 to '20 . he was fired after the school uncovered recruiting violations . in 2023, the NCAA's committee on infractions concluded the program committed 18 Level I violations - mostly related to paying prospects and their families .

title: Transfer portal: Tracking who intends to move
content: College football's transfer portal officially opens at midnight ET on Jan. 2. However, players have been announcing their intentions to transfer since the regular season ended. Once the portal opens, players have until Jan. 16 to enter their name to transfer. It doesn't mean they have to find their new schools by then -- or that they can't return to their previous schools. We are tracking the notable players entering the portal as well as those players who will re-sign with their current schools. Here's the latest news and updates on how the 2026 season could be transformed.

title: 'He just took over': How Mark Fletcher became the engine powering Miami's run
content: Shannon Dawson's game plan was to throw the kitchen sink at Texas A&M . he would run every twist on every play he could imagine until something broke . the score was tied at 3 and both offenses had traded blows in a battle of attrition .

title: Jurors say Skaggs, Angels shared blame for overdose death
content: jurors heard two months of testimony in wrongful-death civil suit between the los Angeles Angels and the family of deceased pitcher . they told ESPN their verdict was hardly a landslide for the plaintiffs and that all sides -- including Skaggs -- deserved blame for the overdose that killed him in 2019 . a last-minute settlement between the club and skateggs' family, details of which were not disclosed, prevented juror's from rendering a verdict .

title: Trump greenlights Greenland grab: US prez names special envoy; what it means
content: landry will serve in a voluntary capacity, tasked with advancing US interests in Greenland and engaging with stakeholders on the island‚Äôs future . he has no formal diplomatic background in Arctic affairs and no known personal ties to Denmark . his selection reflects political loyalty rather than conventional diplomatic credentials .

title: 'Local-level confusion': How Kharge's remark adds twist to Sidda vs DKS power tussle in K'taka
content: The TOI News Desk comprises a dedicated and tireless team of journalists who operate around the clock to deliver the most current and comprehensive news and updates to the readers of The Times of India worldwide. With an unwavering commitment to excellence in journalism, our team is at the forefront of gathering, verifying, and presenting breaking news, in-depth analysis, and insightful reports on a wide range of topics. The TOI News Desk is your trusted source for staying informed and connected to the ever-evolving global landscape, ensuring that our readers are equipped with the latest developments that matter most." Read More

title: India-NZ FTA in trouble? Kiwi FM says will vote against deal; cites tariffs on dairy
content: the TOI Business Desk is a vigilant and dedicated team of journalists committed to delivering the latest and most relevant business news from around the world to readers of the Times of India . the desk ensures that TOI readers are well-informed about the ever-changing and dynamic world of commerce .

title: Donroe doctrine: Is Venezuela the next Iraq, or will Xi take on Trump?
content:
Ayush Pandey is a journalist at the Times of India. He covers breaking news, political developments, and key legal and policy shifts across India and the world, with a focus on politics, elections, and institutional affairs.

He also specialises in analytical explainers and in-depth feature stories that examine the broader implications of political alliances, policy changes, and evolving public sentiment. Read More

title: MLB offseason grades: Red Sox deal for Contreras, White Sox land Murakami
content: the 2025-26 offseason is officially here, and we have you covered with grades and analysis for every major signing and trade this winter . if it's a big-money free agent signing that changes the course of your team's future, we'll weigh in with what it all means for next season and beyond .

title: Let's overreact to Week 16: Broncos won't be the 1-seed? Macdonald is COY?
content: the pre-Sunday NFL Week 16 games were completely wild and massively consequential . the results feel weightier, mainly because there isn't much time left to fix problems that result from them . if the Buccaneers lose a playoff spot, they will meet again in week 18 .

title: From Lane Kiffin to Pat Fitzgerald, we rank every FBS coaching hire
content: former Nebraska quarterback Scott Frost returned to Lincoln to save a flailing cornhuskers program . he went 16-31 and was fired early in his fifth season . former Ohio State player and longtime Buckeyes assistant Luke Fickell took the Wisconsin head coaching job .

title: AgustaWestland: Court reserves order on Christian Michel‚Äôs plea seeking release in CBI case
content: The release was sought on the grounds that he had already undergone the maximum period of sentence of seven years for the charges against him

title: Bangladesh High Commission stops visa services citing ‚Äòsecurity situation‚Äô
content: Over the weekend, there were sharp exchanges between India and Bangladesh after a group of men came to the main gate of the Bangladesh mission in Delhi and shouted slogans

title: SC constituencies in Tamil Nadu see lower reduction in electorate size due to Special Intensive Revision
content: Around 32,080 voters have been deleted in every SC constituency, while the State‚Äôs average is 41,615, according to data gathered from draft rolls

title: Telangana govt. announces one-time 90% interest waiver on GHMC property tax arrears
content: Decision taken after examining proposal submitted by GHMC Commissioner, seeking relief for taxpayers with long-pending dues

title: Will not let W.B. become Bangladesh, says BJP leader and actor Mithun Chakraborty
content: Ever since violence erupted in Bangladesh, the West Bengal BJP leadership has been trying to draw a parallel between the situation in Bangladesh and West Bengal

title: Congress core committee yet to reach consensus on mayoral candidate in Kochi Corporation
content: The core committee comprises of UDF chairman Dominic Presentation, District Congress Committee president Mohammed Shiyas, and senior leader N. Venugopal

title: Two tanks within Kochi Corporation limits need urgent intervention, says KWA
content: The assessment was done in the wake of the recent incident at Thammanam, where a 1.35-crore-litre water tank burst, leading to water supply disruption and causing significant damage to nearby properties

title: Ashok Gehlot accuses Centre of ‚Äòselling‚Äô Aravallis, alleges conspiracy behind policy changes
content: Former Chief Minister Ashok Gehlot termed Union Environment Miniser Bhupendra Yadav‚Äôs claim that only 0.19% of the Aravallis would be open for mining ‚Äúmisleading and factually incorrect‚Äù¬†

title: Prepare for multiple possibilities while navigating uncertainty of career choices, say experts at webinar
content: While academic degrees are important, better communication skills, digital literacy, critical thinking, and problem solving should be at the core of every learning, say the speakers

title: Jammu and Kashmir DGP calls for 'firm vigil on¬†terror groups, supporters‚Äô
content: Nalin Prabhat‚Äôs statement comes at a time when security has been heightened across J&K, including at all major installations

title: Minister should clarify number of hills in Aravalli Range per new definition, urges Aravalli Virasat Jan Abhiyaan
content: The Environment Ministry should hold immediate consultations with rural and urban people living in every block of every Aravalli district in Gujarat, Rajasthan, and Haryana, said the coalition group

title: Tamil Nadu government employees and teachers to go on strike from January 6
content: JACTTO-GEO office-bearers made the announcement after holding talks with Ministers¬†E.V.¬†Velu, Thangam¬†Thennarasu, and¬†Anbil¬†Mahesh¬†Poyyamozhi. They called the negotiations ‚Äúdisappointing‚Äù

title: PSU signs pact with France‚Äôs Safran group to make advanced defence systems in India
content: India Optel and Safran will jointly manufacture two key systems widely used in artillery guns, missiles, radars, anti-drone applications; Defence Ministry says the venture will reduce dependency on imports

title: Forests cannot be used for non-forestry purposes, including agriculture: Supreme Court
content: Bench upholds appeal filed by Karnataka government against Gandhi Jeevan Collective Farming Cooperative Society, which wanted extension of lease on 134 acres of forest, which had been illegally granted to them for cultivation

title: Bombay High Court dismisses plea seeking CBI probe against Pawar family over Lavasa project
content: The Bench says the petitioner failed to¬†establish¬†any statutory basis for the relief¬†sought and the petition lacked merit

title: As nurses continue protest, Health Minister Ma. Subramanian offers 723 new posts
content: Despite the offer from the government, nurses affiliated to the Tamil Nadu Nurses Empowerment Association have decided to continue their protest, demanding more negotiations

title: Watch: Pregnant woman killed in suspected honour attack in Karnataka
content: A 19-year-old pregnant woman was brutally attacked in Inam Veerapur village, Karnataka, in a suspected honour killing, days after returning to her village following an inter-caste marriage. Her husband and in-laws were also injured.

title: From healthy cakes to Secret Santa, Bengaluru shines with Christmas cheer
content: While demand for items like plum cakes and rum balls¬†remain¬†high across the markets, vegan cake varieties like dates, walnut and almond cakes¬†are also picking up, apart from eggless and wineless cakes, say shopkeepers

title: VB-G RAM G Act is not demolition of MGNREGA but overdue repair: BJP rebuts Sonia Gandhi's allegations
content: The Congress leader, in an article titled ‚ÄòThe bulldozed demolition of MGNREGA‚Äô, had said the "death" of MGNREGA is a collective failure. Criticising her over the article, BJP IT department head Amit Malviya said the article reads less like a serious engagement with law or data and more like a flight of political fancy.

title: BJP received ‚Çπ6,088 crore in donations in 2024-25, nearly 12 times more than the Congress
content: Prudent Electoral Trust¬†was the top donor, disbursing ‚Çπ2,668 crore¬†to 15 parties in the last fiscal; other sources include individuals, corporates, and institutions donating directly

title: BLOs protest in Kolkata against fresh workload, clash with police

title: In NITI Aayog‚Äôs road map for ‚Äòinternationalisation‚Äô of higher education, plans for scholarships, Erasmus+-like programmes, and a $10 billion research fund

content: Civil servants will play a pivotal role in achieving the ambitious goal of becoming a Viksit Bharat by 2047, the vice president said

title: Congress demands Railway Minister‚Äôs resignation over train fare hike
content: Congress leader Ajoy Kumar said that the fare had been hiked twice since June 2024 when the Narendra Modi government came to power for the third time. The fares had gone up by 107% in the last 10 years, he said

title: District-wise plan to demarcate mining areas in Aravalli Range in the works: Environment Minister
content: Under fire from environmental activists and a social media storm alleging that vast tracts of the Aravalli Range may be opened for mining, Bhupender Yadav stressed that no new mining licenses would be awarded

title: CPI(M) MP terms Priyanka Gandhi Vadra‚Äôs presence at Speaker‚Äôs tea party unfortunate
content: Senior CPI(M) leader John Brittas questioned why Ms. Vadra chose to attend the tea-party hours after MGNREGA was dismantled by the government in Parliament.

title: UDF set to head Alappuzha municipal council with Independent‚Äôs support
content: With his backing, the UDF - which emerged as the single largest bloc with 23 seats in the 53-member council - is set to form the administrative council. The LDF follows closely with 22 seats

title: Murders, dacoity, and riots fell in 2025, says Bihar government
content: Official says murder cases fell by 7.72%, dacoity by 24.87% and riot cases by 17.97%; no Maoist violence reported in Bihar in the past 3-4 years

title: Mananchira-Malaparamba stretch likely to be ready by January, says Public Works Minister
